intro: Rostraria neglecta, commonly known as the slender rostraria, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Rostraria neglecta is often found in rocky or dry soils, thriving in well-drained environments. It is a relatively uncommon species, with limited distribution and specific ecological requirements.
